Class TermsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jr7.cystudy.controller.TermsController

public class TermsController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller for all things having to do with Terms objects

    Zach Gorman

    • Method Detail

      • addFlashCard

        @PostMapping(path="/add-card")
 @ResponseBody
public java.lang.String addFlashCard(@RequestBody
                                                                                   Terms t)
        Endpoint to add a term to a class. Checks if the class exists, and if it does, adds the card. We don't check if the topic exists, b/c it either didn't, or does now with this addition. That will be fixed... later...
        Parameters:
        t - Terms object containing at least term, answer, and classname
        Returns:
        String saying that the class doesn't exist, or was succesfully added.

      • getTermsByClass

        @GetMapping(path="/get-terms-by-class")
 @ResponseBody
public java.util.List<Terms> getTermsByClass(@RequestParam
                                                                                                    java.lang.String className)
        Endpoint to get all of the terms belonging to a specific class
        Parameters:
        className - name of the class to get the terms for
        Returns:
        List of Terms objects (JSON when called from endpoint).
        See Also:
        TermsService

      • getTermsByTopic

        @GetMapping(path="get-terms-by-topic")
 @ResponseBody
public java.util.List<Terms> getTermsByTopic(@RequestParam
                                                                                                   java.lang.String className,
                                                                                                   @RequestParam
                                                                                                   java.lang.String topic)
        Endpoint to get all of the terms for a specific topic in a specific class. Class name must be specified b/c it is possible for multiple classes to have topics of the same name (e.g. Chapter 1, etc.).
        Parameters:
        className - name of the class the topic belongs to
        topic - name of the topic
        Returns:
        null if the topic doesn't exist, or the List of Terms objects (as a JSON if called via HTTP)

      • getClassTopics

        @GetMapping(path="get-class-topics")
 @ResponseBody
public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getClassTopics(@RequestParam
                                                                                                                java.lang.String className)
        Endpoint to get all of the topics for a specific class.
        Parameters:
        className - name of the class to ghet the topics of
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Strings containing all of the topics

      • deleteCard

        @PostMapping(path="/delete-card",
             produces="application/json",
             consumes="application/json")
 @ResponseBody
public java.lang.String deleteCard(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                        Terms t)
        Endpoint to delete a specific flashcard that matches the specified parameters
        Parameters:
        t - Terms object containing at least classname, term, and answer
        Returns:
        String defined in TermsService
